P006728.project_name: Palmira Water Supply and Sewerage Project

keywords.cdata: alum,billing,board members,Cash Flow,chemical treatment,chlorination,clean water,competitive basis,Construction,cubic meter,detention,dissolved oxygen,distribution system,distribution systems,drainage,Environmental Quality,filtration,Floc,flocculators,garbage,ground water,investment program,iron,liters per capita per day,liters per second,manganese,mixers,municipal company,Municipal Council,municipal decree,municipalities,national water supply,operational deficiencies,pipes,piping,pollution,Population Growth,population growth rate,potable water,Public Health,Public Utilities,public utility,quantities of water,Raw water,regional water resources,rivers,rural water,rural water supply,safe water,sand filters,sanitary conditions,sedimentation,sewage,Sewage treatment,Sewerage,Sewerage Sector,sewerage services,sewerage system,sewerage systems,sewers,sludge,storm water,surface water,tariff increase,towns,Untreated sewage,urban area,urban areas,urban centers,urban growth,urban water,urban water supply,valves,wastes,water consumption,water distribution,water meters,water production,Water Supply,water supply assets,water supply service,water supply systems,water systems,water treatment,water treatment plant

project_abstract.cdata: The project would include a new water treatment plant, improvements to the existing plant, a new water main from the plant to the city and substantial additions to the distribution system; the most urgent sewerage and drainage works would also be constructed.
